response.overview: Bill Gabriel Young (Bashar Shbib), a B-filmmaker with a past, discovers he has some kind of blood cancer. He sets out to do his final film as he spends his last days with his children Tanya, Laila and Amir (Maïa Nadon-Chbib, Camille Fortin-Chbib and Tadzeo Horner-Chbib). He finally tells his three children that, by intuitive feeling, he was going to soon die of this cancer. Before succumbing to death, he is determined to tell them his views on the state of the world, conflicts, people’s irreconcilable differences, and lastly about love. Through the voyage of a kiss, which is what ultimately brings them and life together.
response.title: The Kiss
